Content: -Hemosiderin. Basically c comes from a blood leak and has iron in it that causes oxidation resulting in cell damage. I have siderosis- Hemosiderin on the brain.

Content: -I had a brain tumor removed and there must have been a slow blood leak after close up.

Author: Chelle Rose
Content:
I love my broccoli rabe, arugula, Brussels sprouts, mustard greens and broccoli too!! 😋
All my faves!
As a hint: BRabe can be steamed too! I grew up eating it Italian style which is time consuming and looses nutrients; I never enjoyed it so much to so often since I started using the steamer recommended by MM and steaming up a bunch at a time in just a few mins and digging in. So good!

Author: Nancy Pavlicek
Content: Creamy garlicy broccoli cauliflower soup with chopped steamed potatoes in it is a delicious way to use broccoli.

Author: Raffi Dorian
Content: -Nancy Pavlicek sounds delicious! Great combo.

Author: Molly Berryman
Content: -Nancy Pavlicek got a recipe?

Author: Nancy Pavlicek
Content:
--Recipe: 1 T extra virgin olive oil or use water

2 medium onions, chopped

4 cloves garlic, minced

4 carrots, diced (optional)

2 medium head broccoli, finely chopped (florets and stalk, about 8 cup)

2 medium head cauliflower, finely chopped (about 8 cup)

2 small-medium potato, diced

1/2 cup gf flour

7-8 cups water or broth

2 cup unsweetened cashew or almond milk or sub 1/2 c. coconut cream

1-2 tsp kosher salt (to taste)

2 tbsp lemon juice

steamed potatoes diced (optional)

Instructions

Heat oil in a soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion, 1/2 tsp salt, and a grind of pepper and sauté for 5 minutes, or until softened. Add garlic and cook for another minute.

Add carrots, broccoli, cauliflower, and potato and sauté for another 3-5 minutes. Add flour and stir well to combine.

Add broth, milk and another 1/2 tsp salt. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 15-20 minutes or until veggies are tender. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice. Season with salt/lemon juice to taste until the flavors really pop.

Use an immersion blender to blend half the soup, leaving some chunky for texture. You can also blend half in a blender, being careful as the soup will be very hot!  Or my favorite way is to blend all of it and use it as a delicious, creamy base for steamed potatoes cut into 1/2 inch pieces
